meanings.definition: The state or quality of being old or elderly.
meanings.sent1: Her senectitudes were evident in the way she moved slowly and carefully.
meanings.sent2: The nursing home was filled with the senectitudes of its residents.
meanings.sent3: Despite her senectitudes, Grandma still had a twinkle in her eye and a mischievous smile.
meanings.sent4: Time had painted her face with the senectitudes of wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the senectitudes of the old man, his wrinkles telling stories of a life well-lived.

meanings.definition: The process of aging or growing old.
meanings.sent1: The senectitudes of the tree were visible in its gnarled branches and weathered bark.
meanings.sent2: As the years passed, the senectitudes of the town became more pronounced.
meanings.sent3: The senectitudes of the car were evident in its creaks and groans as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The senectitudes of the building were a testament to its long history and enduring strength.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the senectitudes of time in his painting, the colors fading like memories.
